titleStmt.title: A ful and round ansvver to N.D. alias Robert Parsons the noddie his foolish and rude Warne-word comprised in three bookes, whereof, the first containeth a defence of Queene Elizabeths most pious and happie gouernment, by him maliciously slaundered. The second discouereth the miserable estate of papists, vnder the Popes irreligious and vnhappy tyrannie, by him weakely defended. The third, toucheth him for his vnciuill termes and behauior, and diuers other exorbitant faults and abuses, both here and elsewhere by him committed, and cleareth his vaine obiections and cauils.
titleStmt.author: Sutcliffe, Matthew, 1550?-1629.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Richard Field] for George Bishop,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Parsons, Robert. The warn-word to Sir Francis Hastinges wast-word.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Some print faded and show-through; some pages stained; tightly bound.
